author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 650, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1653061569}
review:
The linux version works through WINE, first of all. A half-hearted effort (much like the rest of the experience) to port the game, but it did work fine for me (except the intro video didn't play correctly, occasionally).

Okay, here is my review of Iron Sky: Invasion. I had the same problem with this game that I did with the movie. First, I loved Star Wreck: The Pirkinning, so when I saw Iron Sky, I was surprised that I could not sit through the whole thing. This game and that movie both missed what made Star Wreck so awesome, which is not taking itself too seriously. Iron Sky (both the game and the movie) found some funding, and they set out to make the great extravaganza where Nazis waged war from the moon. And because they spent all this money, they wanted the viewers to be really focused on all the gags where they spent that money. Take this serious!, it seems to say. But the whole thing is ridiculous and it does not do well when taken seriously. Did they really make it feel like the International Space Station is shooting laser beams? No? then don't draw a lot of attention to the half-hearted 3D model. Is the Sarah Palin impersonator tell any good jokes? No? then don't stop the entire game to make me watch it.

Iron Sky should have been made on a shoe-string budget and given the B-Movie treatment it deserved, where the creators focused on silly jokes that made fun of themselves, instead of trying to deliver a AAA level entertainment. They really missed the mark despite trying so hard. What you have here is an expensive game engine with only passable gameplay interrupted by professional actors telling not funny jokes.

Don't spend your time trying to find anything redeeming about Iron Sky. Instead, go [url=http://m.youtube.com/watch?v=RHAPXlVq5lk]watch Star Wreck: the Pirkinning[/url] (on youtube), and laugh along with the creators -- because they know what you know -- it's a cheezy, b-movie but they are having fun with it anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025318503', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1510091139}
review:
This might be a very good game to blow off some steam when you get home. Site down, shoot some nazis, fly through space and listen to some decent music.

[h1]BUT[/h1]

- The game is really repetitive, almost no story
- Quite often I have to [b]restart my computer[/b] because it will not exit properly, it's stuck in a black screen. Task manager is not visible.
- Achievements are hit and miss. Some trigger, most don't. I find this frustrating
- The acting is really bad. Not B-movie bad, worse. I skip most cutscenes.

Certainly not worth €20, 5 years after release.

review: "เมื่อนาซีกลับมาสานต่อเจตนารมณ์ของฮิตเลอร์อีกครั้ง แต่ครั้งนี้มาจากอวกาศ" จริงๆชอบพล็อตเรื่องของภาพยนตร์ Iron Sky(2012) มาก มันแปลกดี ก่อนจะจบสงครามโลกครั้งที่2 นาซีได้สร้างยานอวกาศ แล้วขึ้นไปตั้งถิ่นฐานบนดวงจันทร์ เพื่อรอวันกลับมาแก้มือหลังจากแพ้ในสงคราม เหตุการ์ในเกมจะอยู่ในช่วงท้ายๆของภาพยนตร์ซึ่งเราจะต้องขัดขวางการบุกโจมตีโลกจากนาซีดวงจันทร์ แผนที่ในเกมเป็นแบบโลกเปิด ยานรบมี Class ให้เลือก และสามารถอัพเกรดยานได้ และยังมีเรื่องของพลังงานภายในยาน เช่น เชื้อเพลิง เกราะ และอาวุธ ที่เราจะต้องคอยจัดสรรด้วย(เอาจริงๆพอใกล้หมดก็วิ่งกลับยานแม่เพื่อเติม จากนั้นออกมาลุยต่อ) เกมนี้คล้ายๆกับโหมด Space Battle ของ Star Wars Battlefront 2 Classic คือให้อารมณ์เดียวกันเลยต่างกันแค่ Star Wars Battlefront 2 Classic นั้นไม่มีการอัพเกรดยานและเรื่องเชื้อเพลิงพลังงาน โดยส่วนตัวแล้วเกมนี้ก็สนุกใช้ได้

author: {'steamid': '76561198207898023', 'num_games_owned': 2355, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1546376144}
review: I'm a big fan of the old X-wing and Wing Commander games and have been looking for another game of that sorts for a while and so far Iron Sky: Invasion is the closest to capturing that feel. Combined with the b-movie style ingame movies featuring characters from the movie it rounds it into a pretty fun experience. I only have a few hours put into the game but have enjoyed every minute of it. Personally I waited for the game to go on sale before buying it, I wouldn't recommend buying it for full price but I would recommend buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053586883', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1509555542}
review:
Un jeu de combats spatiaux excellent. Graphiquement très beau , il régalera vos yeux. Du côté de l'action vous serez servi car c'est un jeu très nerveux. Des dialogues comiques et un scénario absurde complètement assumé.
Essayez le â petit prix , il vaut le coup même si il est un peu court. 
Pour ceux qui critiquent la maniabilité , changez de style de jeu , ça ne vous convient tout simplement pas...

author: {'steamid': '76561197998701258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1501928275}
review:
I'm well into the second act on this one, and to be honest, with only a few hours on the clock, I think I've seen everything there is to see in this game, other than the story.

This game is a nice enough space shooter. First or Third person (default is third. First is HUD only, no cockpit) with nice enough graphics - somewhat reminiscent of the gameplay in games like Wing Commander.

Essentially, you fly around, kill bad guys of various types, and hit waypoints to unlock full motion video story segments. 

The space combat is fun, but pretty basic. There's not a lot to write home about here - which is a shame. A bit more depth would have absolutely MADE this.  The video scenes are...

Well. The 'actors' shouldn't give up their day jobs. It's like the game devs went out of their way to find terrible actors, and then built a really cringe-worthy script around them. It's horrible in a "I really can't stop watching this" kind of way.

If you've seen the Iron Sky movie, then you'll know what to expect.

In short, I'd have to say that this is a fun game. I'll recommend it while it's on special. I don't know about full price... I'd say wait for it to be on special. It's definitely bad, but in a Sharknado kind of way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006217347', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1501122540}
review:
Is this a bad game? It is but in a "so bad it's good" sort of way. The flight controls are super basic and most of the enemies are trivially easy to beat once you know what you are doing but it's just fun to blast nazi space saucers. I can't even point my finger on what makes the combat in this game enjoyable, I should hate this game given how primitive it is but I enjoy it. 

Another thing to note is the cutscenes, the closest thing they remind me of are the cutscenes in Red Alert series, they are corny, full of stereotypes and display a "pornstar" tier of acting ability but dammit I love them. I missed cheesy game cutscenes that don't take themselves seriously and I reckon this game is worth getting just for them but only at a discount.

Don't get this at full price but get it on 50% off if you like basic space games and deliciously cheesy cutscenes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992456413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1500815635}
review:
die story ist mal ein bischen was anderes und die charaktere werden durchaus gut dargestellt (alles ein bischen zugespitzt); vom spielprinzip ist's dann aber doch nur standard; es ändert sich von mission zu mission nur die rahmenhandlung, aber das was man macht is immer das gleiche...
ein großes problem ist aber, daß das spiel konsequent am anfang des dritten kapitels abstürzt... für die windows version scheint es wohl einen workaround zu geben der meißtens funktioniert, aber bei linux ist man da aufgeschmissen (wie's bei mac aussieht, weiß ich nicht)... der fehler ist seit langem bekannt, aber es passiert nichts... daher nur was für wagemutige oder leute die spiele eh nicht zuende spielen....

author: {'steamid': '76561198079763299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1579477144}
review:
As far as movie tie-ins, this one's rather good. It's a simple space shooter, similar to the old Tie Fighter and Wing Commander series, narrated in the same style as the movie. What sets it apart from the basic cheap space shooters is the fact that there is persistence between the missions and the AI keeps fighting among themselves even when you're not around. It can be played in first person view but there is no cockpit. It supports the Xbox 360 controller but not a proper HOTAS setup. 

Definitely worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149354438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1476085813}
review:
First off I just want to state that this game plays okay. There's no issue I have personally found with the gameplay.

Now then, onto the review: The game is bad. It's hilariously bad. It's so bad but also good that you have to play it at least once to understand why I gave this a thumbs up anyway.

The controls are fine, I can't honestly say much about the game its self in terms of function, it's fairly alright.


But the concept. 

THE CONCEPT.

It's propaganda at its finest and I'm almost certain that there was Sarah Palin in there if that's how you spell the bimbos name. The concept is literally space nazis, where the US is basically the center of the world so much as to where one line in the game literally calls the president "President of the world".  

From what I am aware the game is you fighting off space nazi ships in a sub par at best style of gameplay whilst there's a giant bloody space zepplin trying to hurl a freakin meteorite at the planet or something. The amount of political propaganda in this game topped off with the somewhat okay-ish gameplay just makes for a hell of an hour to laugh at something while also not deeply and suicidally regretting your time being lost. 

If you want to get this game, get it on sale. It's funny, and the gameplay is enough that I could sit through just one hour without wanting to cut my arms off immediately, so at least you can play it and not want to throw it out of a window.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098171854', 'num_games_owned': 1295, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1497140392}
review:
[h1] Iron Sky: Invasion [/h1]

[i] O ùnico problema sério do jogo é um conflito do DX11 que desconecta o jogo da Steam e as vezes impossibilita completar as conquistas Steam, você completa os objetivos mas não pega a conquista.

No futuro próximo, a humanidade enfrenta a maior ameaça à sua posteridade na história registrada: uma horda nazista invasora, renascida nas profundezas do espaço! Uma armada dos navios do quarto Reich, construída em segredo em uma base oculta na lua, desce sobre a Terra para chover terror e destruição.
Mas isso não é feito sem resistência. Um grupo de pilotos de espaço de crack pisou para defender a Mãe Terra de se tornar a nova pátria deste regime retorcido. Um piloto solitário, entrando no hangar para ver três navios de protótipos state-of-the-art que o aguardam, sabe que ele é o único que pode salvar o planeta Terra. Cabe a ele e a seus irmãos em armas garantir que a humanidade permaneça livre da gema do nazismo para o bem e para todos ...

Definido durante o conflito principal do filme, "Iron Sky: Invasion" coloca os jogadores no cockpit de um novo starfighter avançado, para testar suas habilidades de poder, vôo e cachorros contra o próximo Blitzkrieg-on-high. Os principais objetivos são defender a Terra e suas instalações espaciais dos ataques inimigos, destruir o maior número de navios nazistas para o esquecimento, humanamente possível, coletar e administrar habilmente os recursos necessários, e torná-lo vivo para o confronto final ... onde a arma secreta final da Quarta Reich aguarda aqueles insensatamente corajosos o suficiente para pegar o martelo e cincel de heroísmo e tentar esculpir seus nomes nas pastilhas da história. [/i]

[h1] Jogabilidade: [/h1]

[i] O filme em si era apenas a primeira etapa do assalto. Agora, após a conclusão dos créditos, a verdadeira greve começa com "Iron Sky: Invasion", o videogame oficial do filme. O jogo coloca os jogadores no controle direto de um piloto avançado de combate espacial, inclinado para proteger a Terra de uma invasora nazista do espaço exterior. Criada pelos arquitetos da série RTS européia mais popular do mundo, a franquia "Terra" ("Terra 2140 "," Terra 2150 "e" Terra 2160 "), e o RPG mais vendido" Dois Mundos "e" Dois Mundos II "," Ferro Céu: Invasão "embala mais poder de fogo do que uma matriz de mísseis espacial e , Assim como o filme, substituirá as expectativas de seu gênero. O futuro do combate espacial começa em 2012. [/i]

[h1] Características principais: [/h1]

[i] [olist]
 [*]Uma jogabilidade única e generosa para o gênero - simulação de vôo espacial e combate, com elementos da estratégia em tempo real

 [*]Um universo de 3-D excitante preenchido com efeitos impressionantes para combinar com os do filme, cortesia do poderoso mecanismo GRACE2

 [*]Estrutura de jogo vanguardista: sem divisão em missões únicas, "Iron Sky: Invasion" é uma batalha gigante de campo aberto

 [*]Proteja os satélites e as bases da Terra, repelindo a frota do quarto Reich
Mapa em tempo real do espaço exterior

 [*]Gestão inovadora de energia: os jogadores podem transferir o poder do navio entre motores, escudos e armas, dependendo das necessidades do momento

 [*]Reprodução elevada: muitas missões laterais e um sistema de pontuação desafiador
Ação sem parar de espectaculares combates de navio a navio para rivalizar mesmo as maiores batalhas espaciais da sabedoria de ficção científica

 [*]Gerenciamento de recursos: os jogadores podem escapar partes de naves espaciais destruídas, coletando elementos preciosos para aprimoramentos

 [*]Múltiplas armas: lasers, mísseis homing e até mesmo armas nucleares táticas são apenas alguns exemplos do vasto arsenal à disposição dos jogadores

 [*]A tecnologia de combate aprimorada permite aos jogadores implantar satélites e drones por ofensas e, igualmente, defender-se com flares e matrizes anti-mísseis

 [*]Inteligência Artificial Avançada para desafiar mesmo o piloto mais crackshot

 [*]Várias classes de navios: Fighter, Bombardeiro Pesado e Gunboat

 [*]Atualizações massivas: o docking da estação de entrada abre uma economia de jogo fácil de usar, permitindo que os jogadores acessem centenas de atualizações de navios

 [*]Muitas classes de navios aliados podem ajudar os jogadores em uma pitada

 [*]Numerosas aulas de navio inimigo, da Valquíria ao temível Götterdämmerung

 [*]Diversas frotas de ataque inimigo exigem estratégias dinâmicas e adaptáveis.

[h1] 08 / 10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198050347543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1496292665}
review:
If you loved the movie you will love this. It has all the hallmarks of a 'bad' space comedy and the FMV with some of the film actors are freaking hilarious. Haven't tried the DLC yet but they both sound enjoyable.
The flight sim itself isn't anything new or different but it's an upgrade from what you might have loved about Xwing and Freelancer.
The combats can become tedious as they are a lot of rinse and repeat style sorties and the side missions aren't anything too interesting but the dialogue and the pilot's comments are amusing enough that you can class this game as more of a comedy than a space flight sim.
Enjoyable enough that I'm willing to do the campaign again, only annoyance is something glitched and I missed out on over half the mission essential achievements. Vanity more than anything else but hey I earned them :P
Worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281484746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1485592276}
review:
Madam President Palin-lookalike is back.

And so are the Nazis to take over the earth using their spaceships to invade the planet.

Your mission is a simple one...
Kill all the Nazis... That's it.
But that is easier said than done, as you are just a simple pilot, with a crappy little vessel of your own.

Some of the characters you have come to love from the movie are back.
The humor that made the movie successful is back as well, but there are a few misses from time to time.

The audio is great, and the graphics are very well done, but not the greatest.
The cut scenes are of good quality, and for the most part, funny, and entertaining.

They could've worked on the combat mechanics a little more.
The controls can be sensitive, and the aim is not the most accurate.

All and all, it is a fun, and humorous game to play, that I would recommend you get on special, if possible.

Don't take my word for it, and check out my video by clicking on the link.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pyH_7hPZLiY&list=PLGCO4EfbVB6XXoAnQMUJjoEh3c2BLfHx8&index=70

author: {'steamid': '76561197978505954', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1424525310}
review:
Ich würd's ja gerne empfehlen, denn es ist gut gestaltet und lustig gemacht, auf Basis des Films den ich leider noch nie gesehen habe. ABER: Mitten im Game, und ich fürchte eher im ersten Drittel der Handlung, wird man quasi in den Weltraum geworfen und sofort von blitzschnellen Gegnern abgeschossen. Man kann nichts dagegen machen; sie sind übermächtig.

Möglicherweise ist das ein beabsichtigter Teil der Satire, aber da hält sich mein Humor in Grenzen. Es sieht eher so aus als ob das Game zu verheimlichen versucht, daß die restlichen zwei Drittel gar nicht programmiert worden sind. Also knall den Spieler vorher ab und dort ist Schluß.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173683283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1489219677}
review:
On general principle. Unskippable cutscenes should always get a thumbs down. 

The game is brilliant, but 15 minutes of video before you pick up a game and play, that you cannot skip? Is completely fucking unacceptable. 

Fix this issue, and I'll change the thumds down to thumbs up. 

Until then fuck you. 

Nice game otherwise.

review: This game is a lot of fun. The graphics are beautiful, the controls are extremely easy to master, and the cut scenes have a definite Command & Conquer: Red Alert sort of overacting. I do wish my character would shut the hell up because he always comes across as a freshman fratboy...not someone you want to root for (unless you're a freshman ftatboy yourself). Still, very easy to jump into and play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960391844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1486145537}
review:
An intriguing space shooter that ultimately dissapoints. It's pretty good for a movie tie-in game and even somewhat fun to play. It's just enough like a proper space sim to constantly remind me how awesome it could have been if they added some complexity and control options. Really frustrating. It's also full of protection and escort missions, but so easy that they don't really annoy. Also I don't know if it just me, but the final boss fight didn't happen to me at all. A lot of hype about it, a cutscene from the movie and then just victory message. That's odd. Unless you really like shooting Nazi UFOs, I recommend you stay away even at discount. I hear this game uses some questionable DRM too.

It's a shame, really.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997055945', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1063, 'last_played': 1653142681}
review:
Iron Sky를 재미있게 봤던 사람이라면 충분히 만족할 수 있는 게임.
Iron Sky 출연 배우들의 실사 영상들도 포함되어 더욱 흥미를 끈다.
게임 자체의 난이도나 밸런스도 그냥 평이한 정도.
다만 세이브 시스템 상 오류가 존재해서 도전과제 달성에 애로사항이 꽃필 수가 있다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027321505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1628091591}
review:
~ A simple but FUN game : i like the graphics and gameplay is allright if u wanna enjoy some brainless action...𝕀ℕ 𝕊ℙ𝔸ℂℂℂℂℂℂℂℂ𝔼 ! •°*”˜

Yes, cutscenes are cringy, BUT they were MADE to be this way : negative opinions and ppl mocking em didnt understand this ! ^^

Also a good point : the DLC allows, at last-and veeeery few Devs dare to do this- to play as German side in such a specific game style : flyin' n fighting in a German flying saucer from the moon to attack earth is definitely FUN !

author: {'steamid': '76561198160653657', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1673141814}
review:
Was soll ich zu Iron Sky sagen, gutes Spiel ? Naja, es geht so. Die Steuerung ist gewöhnungsbedürftig, die Grafik mittelmäßig. Aber die Story passt gut zum Spiel und man wird mich echt Video Sequenzen durch das Spiel geleitet. So ähnlich wie bei den alten C&C Teilen wo Pornodarsteller uns die nächste Mission erklärt haben ;) 

Kauft das Spiel im Sale und dann ist man auch nicht sehr enttäuscht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027177436', 'num_games_owned': 1115, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1478355312}
review:
This game is not a masterpiece by any means but it doesn't need to be. 
It's tongue in cheek style and simple gameplay which is more or less the same for this genre for decades works as intended. 
Gameplay is smooth, graphics are little empty even for a space simulator though. But it's still a fun shooter. 
Only negative thing I can mention is it has no multiplayer.

review: It's not a bad game if you like trashy ski-fi movies (i.e. LEXX or movie the game based on) and simplistic dogfight sims, like TIE fighter. Only downsides I saw was  somewhat short plot story, relatively easy last battle and really..lack of joystic support in dogfight game. After some practice (that involved memory how I played X-Wing using mouse only before I fetched a joystick) it is manageable, but some nice things that could be possible in combat are just out of reach

author: {'steamid': '76561198000456617', 'num_games_owned': 1434, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1470480616}
review:
Na tu hru jsem se i těšil až si ji zahraji grafika zpracování pak ještě ty krátké filmy co vás provází hrou a je to v CZ je moc potěšilo ale když došlo na ovladání hry tak jsem začal chytat nerva. Lod reaguje na řízení dobře ale tak dobře že je neovladatelná. Ani snižení citlivosti myši nepomuže i tak zaměřování a celková manipulace s lodí je hruza!!!! To kdyby opravili hned by se to ovladalo lepe ale tohle nejde .... 

4/10 jen kvuli ovladání jinak zpracování grafika a vše okolo 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198041512403', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 2456, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1623492103}
review:
우주에서 임무를 수행하라

우주를 이리저리 이동하면서 임무를 수행합니다.
마우스를 이용하여 시점을 변경하면서 휠을 굴려 속도를 조절할 수 있고,
AD로 좌우 회전을 하고 S로 무기 변경 F또는 마우스 클릭으로 공격이 가능하죠.

또한, 독특하게 에너지를 소모하여 쉴드와 무기를 보충할 수 있습니다.
Q로 쉴드를 회복할 수 있고 W로 무기, E로는 다시 에너지로 전환이 가능하더군요.
E랑 W가 반대던가...

적들을 처치하면서 아이템을 획득할 수 있으며
이를 기지에서 판매하여 크레딧으로 바꾼 뒤 시체 강화에 사용할 수 있죠.
또한, 특정 기지에서는 기체의 변경도 가능합니다.

아쉬운 점
-임무 파악이 조금 애매함

author: {'steamid': '76561197973157611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1465798596}
review:
Ouch... this is a game that seems to have a too big budget for making videos and not enough money for development.

The controls are not well designed... Using the mouse to move your space fighter as well as doing mission log and other stuff is a bad bad idea that can almost lead to barfing due to uncontrollable spinning.  That is said, after watching bunches of stupid videos (trying to be in line with the movie with a shortened name than this game), you die again stupidly because of those poor controls... 

The game is not playable as is... and that is probably too bad because the game had some potential for anyone that like the wing commander series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045324116', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1588018597}
review:
I tried with the mouse... and failed
I tried with an Xbox controller... and failed

I want so badly to enjoy this game (loved the film) but the controls are simply awful - on a scale that makes Surgon Simulator feel like an exact and high prescision gaming experience...

If you want to 'trial' this game, play Elite Dangerous, but use a greesy frankfurter as your controller, while viewing the game in a mirror, with 3 second lag. That might come close to how appauling the controls of this game are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104829683', 'num_games_owned': 1495, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1479056676}
review:
Saludos, antes hay que aclarar algo que no comprendo por que? venden el juego como un simulador espacial. si el juego es un arcade en primera persona, al mejor estilo de x-wing, x-wing vs tie figter, etc... les recomiendo buscar gameplay para que vean como son esos juegos. son viejos de los años 90s, basicamente tienes tu mira primera persona o tu nave tercera persona, y vas disparo a todo lo que se mueva, hay misiones que mata a este, o daña lo suficiente a este para capturarlo, o escolta tal nave y defiendola. señores olvidense de un simulador x flight, b17, f14 etc.. ESTO ES UN ARCADE ESPACIAL MUY DIVERTIDO PARA PASAR RATOS.. 

Le doy 8/10  y su duracción: creo que es de unas 8 horas, aun estoy jugandolo llevo 5 horas. (20 de abril de 2016)


+++++++++++ LO BUENO ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++


+++++ Gráficos muy bonitos y fluidos.

+++++ los detalles de las naves graficamente hablando y tambien en la jugabilidad, puedes pelear con naves muy grandes enormes como en x-wing cuando peleabas contra un crucero imperial, tenía que destruir por parte la nave, motores, cañones, las naves pequeñas de defensa que salian de ellos etc... aqui es lo mismo.

+++++ al igual que el x-wing cada cierto tiempo tienes videos con personas reales, que te dan misiones chistes etc....

+++ misiones primarias, secundarias, y podriamos decir misiones extras para levear ? basicamente es como dije un poco mas arriba. atacar, defender, capturar, etc...

++++++++ puedes usar diferentes tipos de naves, y aparte puedes comprar mejoras, algo que en x-wing no podías hacer.


++++ En perfecto español subtitulado.

+++++ el joystick chino generico responde muy bien. (aconsejo jugarlo con joystick, con teclado uhn....)

+++++ la música y sonidos podrían ser mas variados, pero estan bastante bien para un juego indie.


+++++++++++ la historia me ha hecho reir un par de veces xDDD sobre todo el doble sentido de todo.


++++++++ esta bien optimizado a mi no me hadado algun problema tecnico.


------------------ LO MALO -------------------------------------------------------------------


- Falta algun boton en el joystick para tirar las bengalas, basicamente me lo estoy pasando sin bengalas.

- falta de un multiplayer.



recomiendo este juego comprar en oferta. realmente pasaras un buen rato con el y te sacara algunas risas. y si podríamos decir que es rejugable para sacar logros.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998926239', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1460262870}

author: {'steamid': '76561198217106715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1457622604}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197983722524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 3840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3321, 'last_played': 1482123174}
review:
J'avais ce jeu dans ma bibliothèque depuis un paquet de temps, à cause de la jouabilité spéciale j'avais arrêté; un jeu pas facile à prendre en main et qui devient un vrai plaisir une fois les touches assimilées.
Je m'étais dit aussi "mais qu'est ce que c'est que ces tarés d'acteur?!?"
C'est en regardant récemment le film qui en est tiré que ce jeu a prit de l'ampleur: C'est le meilleur film que j'ai vu depuis Avatar, bref, il faut voir le film avant sinon tout paraîtra idiot...
________________________________________________________________________________
On pilote des vaisseaux des nations terriennes, chaque vaisseau possède 3 fonctions à gérer: bouclier; rechargement des armes et boost de vitesse, d'où la difficulté apparente du jeu.
Petit bémol pour les succès très faciles à obtenir il suffit de surveiller sa page des médailles et si elle a sauté (on ne les voit plus), il faut sortir du jeu technique gros doigts ctrl+alt+suppr car l'exe se bloque en parrallèle mais heureusement ça reprend là où on l'avait laissé et tout remarche.
Le mieux est de finir tranquillement le jeu et reprendre les chapitres précédent.
Fonçez voir le film d'une manière ou d'une autre, je peux juste dire que la fin est T.E.R.R.I.B.L.E!

author: {'steamid': '76561198202665255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1481166979}
review: Ever wonder what it would have been like if Hitler perfected his saucer technology and withdrew his forces to the moon? Me neither, but I was pleasantly surprised by this game. First, I'd like to say that I got a copy for only $1.99 using a coupon I received in the Steam Market. Second, upon getting a copy I learned that the game coincides with the movie "Iron Sky". I watched the movie before beginning the game in order to get a better understanding of the plot. The first few minutes were kind of bad, but once I realized it was a comedy more than anything, I was sold. So I went into the game understanding that the plot was meant to be a joke. That aside, the flight mechanics are really good (I played using a Dual Shock 4) other than my ship got stuck on the hulls of much larger ships from time to time, but only if I actually impacted the ship, and it wasn't hard to break out of. The music gets a little repetitive as there aren't that many tracks, but I tended not to notice that too much. The game's weakest point is by far the sub-par acting of the foreign diplomats during the live-action cut-scenes (again watching the movie helps). On the other hand, the game's strongest point is assaulting the space Zeppelins and other capital ships. All-in-all if you like flight simulators, killing Nazis, and can get a copy of this on sale, then it's probably worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040480911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1448927089}
review:
[h1][b]Langeweile im All[/b][/h1]

Ich habe früher Freelancer gespielt bis zum umfallen, die ganzen Systeme und Schlachten, Schiffe Missionen einfach nur der Wahnsinn, mit dem Fan Mod "Discovery" wurde das Spiel komplett erweitert mit unzähligen Schiffen, Systemen und Animation etc. darum hatte ich Hoffnung das Iron Sky vlt etwas des guten Gefühls von damals zurück bringen wird, doch leider war das nicht der Fall. Das Hauptproblem von Iron Sky ist die Langeweile die aufkommt, Die Schiffe sehen langweilig aus, die Schlachten sind langweilig, die Story ist langweilig ja sogar die Musik ist langweilig da es nur 2-3 Stücke gibt die sich ständig wiederholen..unter anderem die Amerikanische Hymne..

[h1][b]Fazit:[/b][/h1] 
Ich habe keinen Spaß gehabt und kann auch jedem von dem Spiel abraten, wer dennoch gerne sich im All umsehen möchte dem rate ich abzuwarten bis es im Angebot ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161084028', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 8914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1564247722}
review:
Ein sehr gutes Spiel das meiner nach das Geld definitiv wert ist,ich habe mir auch gleich die DLC's "Meteorblitzkrieg" und "Zweite Flotte" gekauft, von welchen ich mittelmäßig begeistert war: Meteorblitzkrieg bietet die Möglichkeit eine Walküre der Mondbewohner zu steuern und eine Zeppelinflotte in Erdnahem Orbit gegen Irdische Flotten und berühmte Schiffe wie die G.W. Bush und Mir zu verteidigen, ich bin von Grafik und Sound 100% Grundspiels begeistert und finde es auch nicht allzu schwer, im gegensatz zu "Meteorblitzkrieg" was ich als zu schwer und eher Langweilig empfinde,ausserdem denke ich das man sehr viel mehr aus diesem DLC hätte machen können, beispielsweise war ich enttäuscht davon dass es nur einen einzige Bauklasse(Walküre)und somit keine Auswahl gab.
"Die zweite Flotte" allerdings ist eine ausgezeichnete Ergänzung des Spiels, da man alle Flotten bis zu einem bestimmten Punkt befehligen kann und somit die Leitung der Erd-Streitkräfte quasi übernimmt, als "Flaggschiff" muss man sich hier jedoch kein Schiff kaufen sondern kann von Anfang an auf alle Schiffstypen aller Nationen zugreifen, die Ingame währung wird also nur noch für die Upgrades der Ausgewählten Schiffe benötigt.
Alles in allem gibt es einen Daumen Hoch, ich kann es nur ausdrücklich weiter empfehlen

author: {'steamid': '76561198059173075', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1446469885}
review:
Les points positifs :
-Jeu beau voir très beau graphiquement ! 
-Cinématique réalisée par de vrais acteurs comme dans Red Alert 3 très plaisant avec pas mal d'humour !
-Les musiques sont sympas.
-Diversités des vaisseaux spatiaux 
-Plusieurs quêtes de différentes nations

Point négatif :
-Prise en main compliquée si l'on utilise pas de joystick mais ça reste jouable 
-Les quêtes sont terriblement répétitive : Taper du nazi avec souvent les memes vaisseaux à affronter

Je recommande ce jeu pour tout les amateurs de space opera, de jeux spatiaux à la première personne ou autre, la répétition des quetes est comblée par le reste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045566565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1547127684}
review:
surprisingly fun
i didnt expect so much fun from a game like this
the game is casual enough that you don't need perfect aim, but not so casual that it's virtually impossible to die
you dive head-first a big capital ship witha bomber?
consider yourself dead
i love the weapon-shield-engines energy micro-management
it's "open world"ish. This is, there is a big map where you can in real time choose where to warp
this is fundamental, as you are expected to protect earth while completing your main objectives
there are side quests too, but they require you to stop by a space station (warp close to it is enough) to start the dialogue with each nation, so if you don't stop by them you'll miss out those

EDIT:
after reading many negative reviews, let me make some points staright
- upgrades are "expensive": well, they are at mission 1, but trust me, once you get doing missions and collecting salvage (they sell at a fairly low price, but their drop rate increases sharply in o time, and big vessels drop from 3 toup to 15, so well, there's that), there is no problem. After long battles which happen to be a mission objective you'll end up with more than enough to buy a few (maybe 4 or 5) upgrades. Considering that you have 2 "full time" ships (the rest being temporary for certain chapters), i think that's pretty fair

- combat is difficult: as i said, the game is not easy enough taht you can just stay stationary and shoot enemies. It requires you to keep a good micro on your energy, and transfer energy from engines to weapons or shield or from weapons to shields, or whatever you need, all the time. If you think you got blown up "for no reason", let me iluminate you (let this be word of advice): capital ships, frigates, and some fighters shoot missiles. Some are guided, which you can dismiss with flares(kepp an eye on the count, they are limited and you need to recharge them at a station or with an ammo box). But some are not guided, and these are the most dangerous, because there is no warning that they are coming. Most of the time they will blown up most of your shield and hull, and if you happen to be in a fight with already low shields and/or hull, well, bad news my friend. Remember, always keep an eye out on capital ships BIG cannons, they do very high damage too, so you should prioritize them before attempting to destroy the rest of the subsystems

author: {'steamid': '76561198069175441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1295, 'last_played': 1556841099}
review:
I picked this game up in a BundleStar game bundle, and have finished the game before writing this review. I have used a controller for a majority of my playthrough, and have entered this game without watching the movie.

Let me start with the postive- 
1> The graphics are subpar to good; they look 2012-2013ish with decent lighting effects.
2> Some of the charachters such as the Indian diplomat are memorable and funny
3> When used with a XBOX360 controller, the game handles itself very well

Here are why I cannot recommend the game-

1> Like others have pointed out, this game gets very repetitive very fast- there are barely 4 enemy types, and there is no introduction of any new mechanics after the tutorial itself. Sure, you get to fly a ship with nukes, but they can only be used on asteroids; and even if an enemy is RIGHT next to the asteroid, it takes ZERO damage with the nuke explosion (you get this ship for only one mission, and the ship is pretty bad compared to the regular ones, you have NO reason to use it)

2> The ships cannot be upgraded in a meaningful way or in a way that would impact how you play the game. Your weapon upgrades essentially deal more damage, but you cannot pick buy any more weapons other than the 4 default ones- 2 types of lasers and 2 types of missles. There is a distinct lack of an ingame economy, and aside from 2 missions of 5 minutes each, you have only two ships to chose from. A multi target missle system would be welcome, considering that you have to engage each enemy one at a time, and in a level with over 30 enemies, it can get cumbersome. Moreso, the ships have no special abilities, and aside from cosmetic differences, the only other difference between your main ships are hull and speed tradeoffs.

3> The pacing is awful, the first one hour were very enjotyable with plenty of videos and dialogue, after which things crawled to you essentially receiving a notification that you have a new mission with a distinct lack of dialogue; this combined with the limited ship variery and limited enemy types made the game repetitive and boring. 

4> The way how the game mechanics work- 
a>when you destroy a ship, you get scraps which is converted to money at a space station which you then use to buy things- the scraps fall 5 seconds after you destroy the enemy ship since the fireball of the ship needs to explore- if you are darting through an enemy fleet, you need to take another round to get the scrap, assuming the short timer before the scrap explodes doesn't tick out. There are no abilities to attract or auto collect the scrap.
b> For all the weapons to get a kill efficiently, you need to target an enemy- the game doesn't select the enemy closest to you or the one nearest to your reticule, but rather cycles through each enemy; this means if you have a zepplin with its dock doors open, and you need to quickly get a missle in it to damage the ship; you need to press that next button an infinite number of times before the zepplin is selected, by which time the doors would have closed
c> The game relies on a small text notification at the end of your screen to notify you of mission critial information such as whether a zepplins doors are open or not, or in the tutorial for buttons; I found it easy to ignore that and not know when an event was happening; a more noticable place would be nice; or a flash across the screen or something more visually noticable.

5> The game is unplayable with a keyboard and mouse; the defaut bindings are very awkward to play with, and the mouse has some weird slowing down after I stop moving it; it feels much more refined with a controller.

6> The story is very nice initally, but midway, it gets boring, and the ending is just awful- if you are playing this for the story, don't- it's very threadbare to non-existent, and the ending really ruins it; you have a 15 second video  after a 5-6 hour playhtorugh.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998339185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1438203032}
review:
(Steam says I've only played 10 minutes, but I beat the entire campaign in offline mode)

Overall, it's a decent game with a few flaws that mean it's best bought on sale. The biggest flaw by far is the controls. Keyboard and mouse is next to unplayable, no joystick support (although I couldn't test it myself), but an Xbox controller makes it pretty fun. They're also mostly unconfigurable (you can invert the Y-axis, but not remap buttons). 

The game's two other main flaws sort of exist in a delicate balance. They don't introduce many new mechanics outside of newer, larger enemies, but at the same time it's short enough (the campaign kept moving, but the ending felt sudden and rushed) that I didn't get tired of it until I was trying to get through the DLC. Same goes for the music. There aren't a lot of tracks, but it's short enough that they didn't repeat enough to be annoying.

There are many ships you can play with (some are forced in missions), but upgrades are stuck in the ship you buy them for, so you'll probably be sticking with one ship for almost the whole time. This is a minor flaw, combined with how the upgrades are purely better numbers. Having upgrades that actually change the ships be purchasable (or just the different ships having a real variety of features) would've made it a lot more fun. The actual designs of ships and stations are pretty nice, just like they were in the movie (the cutscenes are practically out of the movie too).

For a movie game, it's exceptional. Flying was fun, and for the $2.49 I paid, I expected a lot less than I got. I have to give the game credit for its scale, too. When a mission told me there was a 3 mile wide asteroid, I expected it to be just a slightly larger version of the normal ones, but instead they genuinely made me feel tiny next to the thing.



The DLC isn't really worth it. One is a more hectic version of a campaign map where you command the other nation's fleets. It's not bad, but it doesn't give you any indication of progress (I was playing for an hour and no end was in sight, so it might be endless). The other lets you play as one of the enemy ships, tasked with fighting the other side of a battle, where you have to hold out for 20 minutes. They're both nice new gamemodes to have, but even for the tiny price I paid, I'd expect something more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042633943', 'num_games_owned': 1391, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1438635421}
review:
Der Film war gut, das Spiel - ich weiß es leider nicht. Die Steuerung ist leider so grauenhaft, dass ich schon nach den ersten Missionen absolut keine Lust mehr auf das Spiel habe. Vielleicht spielt es sich mit Controller besser (soll ja teilweise unterstützt werden) oder vielleicht ist genau dieses Spiel eines der Spiele, für die man den Steam-Controller verwenden sollte um den Spaß zu maximieren. Aber egal wie - für €19,99 ist es eine ziemliche Frechheit, die Steuerung ist einfach mies und das restliche Spiel konnte das in meiner kurzen Spielzeit auch absolut nicht kompensieren. Langweilige Sprecher, schlechte Synchronisation und billige Dialoge, die Story absolut 08/15 und nicht zu vergleichen mit der Story von Iron Sky.

Anstatt das Spiel zu kaufen kann man sich eher den Film besorgen, der macht länger Spaß und kostet weniger.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993437321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1462003689}
review:
At the time of writing this, I have played through all but the very end of the 2nd chapter of the game's story.  More on that later.

If all of the following conditions are true, you will have a great time with this game:

1. You have enjoyed Space Combat Sims such as X-Wing, Tachyon or Wing Commander
2. You have an X-Box controller
3. You do NOT have a flight stick (Caveot: See end of review)
4. You grab it while the price is discounted
5. You do not mind that it uses 3rd party DRM "Reality Pump"

If you have a flight stick you will face-palm at the missed opportunity and this will probably erode your fun factor of the game.

The game's control set up is optimized for a 360 controller, or any controller that is XInput-compatible such as the Logitech F310.  Many features are logically crammed into the little controller.  No keyboard use required.  It feels like this game was designed from the ground up to give some arcadey space-combat fun to gamers who do not have a flight stick.  Marksman-like accuracy is not required.  If the target is "close enough" to your crosshairs, you will hit it.  No sweat.  The emphasis leans more towards management of your shields, weapon energy and missiles.  -as well as making sure you are at the right place at the right time.  When you are up against larger capital ships and targeting their various sub-systems, feel free to wail on them with your missiles.  Don't worry, when you run dry one of your allies will thoughtfully drop a box of missiles for you to pick up.  Did I mention arcadey fun?

The game has a 2D map of the zone of space you will play in.  Pick a location then warp to it.  This reminded me of Star Raiders on the Atari 8-bit computers.  Whoops.. Just dated myself.

The game is based on the movie "Iron Sky."  It is about Nazis from the moon who invade Earth.  I did not see it, but I would like to.  And yes, it is as tongue-in-cheek as it sounds.  The game has "FMV cutscenes" (remember them?).  The production values are small and the quality of acting varies.  Fortunately, the voice of the main character you control is well-acted and likeable.  The quips he makes when taking out a baddie will never make you cringe.  The graphics are quite good for a lower-budget title.  The outer-space skybox is very pretty.  I don't expect to see much variety in the environment as this is about nazis from the MOON who invade EARTH.. Not too much variety of scenery between these two locations.  I wouldn't expect the game to venture too far from this area either.

I don't know if I will continue the game any time soon.  Why did I stop playing it?  Two reasons:

1. At the very end of the 2nd chapter I hit a game-breaking bug.  Reading in the forums I found that other people have experienced this same glitch.  Sometimes playing the entire 2nd chapter again from the start resolves the issue.

2. I got myself a new flight stick and this game doesn't support it.  Makes it difficult to muster the will to play this right now when I could be bringing hot plasma death to my digital enemies in other space combat games that rightfully DO support flight sticks.

Having said that, I still recommend the game for everyone who meets all of the conditions stated at the start of this review.  You'll have a great time and if the game glitches out remember; you only spent a couple of bucks on it! :)

EDIT: X360ce Vibmod will let you map your flight stick axis to the XBox 360 control axis.  I just tried it and it works!  So there is hope for games like these where the developer wants to force you to use one type of controller.  Check out a YouTube video on it here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mUAhkrZKsVs

Make sure you get the latest version.  The one linked in that video is older and did not work so well for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987471006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1438190033}
review:
This game had great potential. The story is great and it has everything needed for a great space shooter.
Now what went wrong? Well, most of it.

My first problem was that my joystick did not work. What kind of dimwit skips joystick support in a space shooter??
Now, it does have support for the Xbox controller for those of you that has one of those.
What else is wrong with the game?
Well, the acting is the worst I have ever seen in a game of movie ever, bar none. It is painful to watch.
I was kind of hoping one actor would do something right, but alas.
The only thing that really shines in the game is the two cutscenes from the movie. Almost gave me goose bumps.

The only part of the game "worth" playing is the invasion, the orignial story. It is the only one that has some kind of narrative.

The two DLC:s I got with the game was not what I consider DLC at all. They are just minigames based on the game.
The first one lets you fight all crooks in a map and suddenly without any warning it just says "Victory" when you have killed them all.
The second DLC was the only one I did not finish so far and that is because the only "mission" is to survive for 20 minutes in a huge battle, well, technically it is protecting zeppelins.

I got this game at a 80% sale and I still do not recommed it. Sure if you get it for 1 Euro, maybe, but there are way way better space shooters out there.
Too bad really for I really like the story of the move and think it would be great in a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008395378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1438199822}
review:
Iron Sky Invasion ist ein gut gelungenes Arcade Space Dogfight Spiel. Es macht Spaß die einzelnen Jäger Typen zu Fliegen und zu Verbessern. Wer an Spielen wie dem alten Wing Commander und ähnlichen Spass hat und etwas mit dem Humor des Films anfangen kann der sollte zugreifen. Wer mehr erwartet als einen Dogfighter im Weltraum der im Iron Sky Universum spielt mit vielen Anspielungen wie im Film selber und einen kleinen Sammel und Upgrade System sollte es sich zweimal überlegen. Alles in allem genau das was ich erwartet habe sogar noch um einiges Lustiger.
Hab mit dem Xbox 360 Pad gespielt und nach kleiner eingewöhnungs phase war die steuerung sehr gut direkt schnell und durch die Zielhilfen schon fast zu einfach.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128086327', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1529672273}
review:
Die Komik des Films haut auch hier gut um sich und lädt zu einem recht kurzweiligen Weltraum-Massaker ein. Man versetzt sich gut und schnell in die Lage des großschnäuzigen Kumpel-Piloten, der mit seinem Rivalen "Kreuzi" den Krieg offenkundig als Einziger so ansatzweise ernst nimmt. Die Dialoge machen Spaß und das Weltraum-Ambiente schmeichelt den Augen. Wer's wie ich mit Maus & Tasta spielt, sollte dringend ne Maus mit "runter"-justierbarer DPI-Einstellung haben, bei 2000 DPI schafft man sonst in 1 Sekunde 2x 360er was bei Aimen kolossal auf die Nüsse geht. Wer sich dann wie ich in ner Raumstation verfängt und fast 2Minuten nich andocken kann, weil man das Labyrinth der Meister erst hinter sich bringen muss, kotzt ab.

So richtig "keinen" Spaß machen die Steam-Errungenschaften, die sind scheinbar fehlerhaft oder triggern nur bei besonderer Sternen-Konstellation. Die 3 die noch offen sind hab ich selbst beim zweiten Mal Durchdudeln trotz erfüllter Goals nicht unlocked bekommen. Laut Discu-Board geht es aber fast allen so und Abhilfe scheint's auch keine zuverlässige zu geben, ergo Müll.

Gesamt-Eindruck: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003931282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1512693597}
review: If you are looking for a hyper real space flight sim, this is not it.  If you are looking for a fun space arcade game, then this is for you.  It is well done and plays smoothly, the controls are simple and easy to learn and it is a blast to play.  It is based off of a movie but it is not required to see it unless you want background information and context of the game.  The game is relatively short, you can finish in a few hours so don't expect days long play to get through it.  The DLC is fun and adds a couple missions to extend your playtime including one that lets you play as the Nazis.  So if you just want a quick arcade style space shooter that is fun to play, look no further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067747282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1429975926}
review:
의외로 재미있습니다.
컨트롤이 키보드로 하기에는 너무 어렵지만 엑박패드를 쓰면 편하고 재미있습니다.
전투도 제법 재미있는데 부위파괴도 구현되있고 유도탄을 플레어로 무력화시킨다던가 전투는 재미있게 할 수 있습니다.
문제는 전투만 해야하고 뭔가 특이한 걸 할 기회가 전혀 없다는 겁니다. 전투가 재밌다지만 4시간을 그것만 하면 거의 미치게 되죠.
그런데다가 작은 적 함선이 날아다니는걸 잡을라면 에임을 한참 돌려서 잡아야 하고 심지어 락온도 시야내에서 잡는게 아니라 아군을 포함한 모든 함선들을 한바퀴 둘러봐야 하니 참 귀찮습니다.
기본적으로 스페이스 오픈월드 비슷한 개념이라는걸 생각하면 더욱 아쉽습니다, 조금 더 신경썻으면 수작이 하나 나왔을테지만 이정도면 추천할만은 하지만 수작의 반영에는 들지 못합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002873255', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1616434597}
review: Iron Sky: Invasion really captured the feel of the film. The gameplay and humour had me gripped from the get go and the reasons behind some of the side missions had me laughing and asking myself "Why me?" I does a great job in expanding the story, ever so slightly, and actually protecting the Earth from the Fourth Reich had me feeling important.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032788858', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 678, 'playtime_forever': 1905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1643, 'last_played': 1424003181}
review:
Убогий космический симулятор с кучей фашистов.

Натуральная халтура - играть скучно. Беспросветный отстрел вражин, накопление бабла и дальнейший апгрейд. Да-да, чтобы дальше мочить ещё более крутых вражин. Местами проскакивают интересные миссии, но их слишком мало, чтобы изменить общую картину мира игры. Видеовставки сделаны добротно, но в какой-то момент ловишь себя на мысли, что разработчики малок ним причастны. А фильм-то неплохой был. Как всегда, короче.

Найди четвертый рейх на Луне! 4 из 10 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198067802968', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1427189058}
review: It is not necessary to have seen the movie to enjoy this game.  The idea of the movie was kinda cool but was poorly executed.  This game makes up for that a bit.  Personally, I found this game much more enjoyable than the movie.  There are numerous fmv style messages that your character receives throughout the game and they reminded me of some the early 90s fmv games.  I bought the game for a laugh (it was on sale with all dlc for $3) and was not disappointed.  The game plays very much like the old Wing Commander games.  If you're looking for a fun little space sim type game or just want to blast off and defend the Earth from the "Space Nazi" invasion then give it a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057756104', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1427081060}
review:
O jogo não é ruim, vale a pena só se for pegar com desconto (fora isso tem opções melhores). Os vídeos das missões são engraçados feito com atores reais do filme de mesmo nome (saiu com o nome Deu a Louca nos Nazi no Brasil).

O ùnico problema sério do jogo é um conflito do DX11 que deconecta o jogo da Steam e as vezes impossibilita completar as conquistas Steam, você completa os objetivos mas não pega a conquista.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035749461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1405160006}
review: Za co spotkało mnie spędzenie czasu z tą grą? Powiem po prostu – chyba miałem świadomość jaki poziom może reprezentować ten tytuł, więc sam jestem sobie winien. Gra jest ekstremalnie nudna. Fragmenty „aktorskie” są długie i tragicznie zagrane. Latanie w kosmosie i strzelanie także nie wygląda ciekawie. Gra wywołuje ból, nie tylko fizyczny, ale także psychiczny. Nie jest to niestety ból wyzwania, ale ból bezsilności i żalu. Według mnie 1+/10.

review: This is a fun, arcadey, very silly, nonrealistic flight sim. It's worth getting if you want to spend a few hours blasting Nazi UFOs out of the sky, but only if you have an XBox controller, as the mouse controls are terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016453707', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1070, 'last_played': 1479975354}
review: First time I played a space genre game and  I kinda like it. It's not that detailed, the missions are the typical, shoot this and that. But that is where it captured me actually. I like the simplicity of it and I guess  anything that involves space ships and shooting asteroids is always fun. The graphics is pretty decent and the soundtrack is pretty intriguing. Intriguing in the sense that they incorporated a "space-like" theme on it, throw in a couple of beats and dub step mixes. It's actually pretty decent in the ears. The missions are pretty absurd sometimes but overall it's ok, I like the simplicity. The cutscenes, well, not full cutscenes but you'll get like a comm interface where you'll get your missions from live actors are pretty well acted. Actors looks like they know the characters they are portraying and they look like they enjoyed it. The game overall is more aimed to fun and not of a space sim not saying that space sims ain't fun. If you like space ships, and shooting without getting into a simulator-ish theme. And if you're a fan of the Iron Sky movie, then this is a game you must check out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007846049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1445007628}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003880648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1478947511}
review:
Da cosa cominciare per descriveramente veramente questo gioco:
Sonoro, in 49 minuti una sola canzone, cantata male e ripetitiva, mi ha fatto venir il mal di testa e quindi mutata.
Astronavi orrende, disegnate male con comandi maledetti, risultato mal di testa.
Storia assurda... ma dove prendono queste idee?
Attori... questi fanno ridere, secondo me sono quelli che hanno fatto il gioco perchè non sanno recitare, le battute neanche nei film più orrendi.
Voto: 2
Il simulatore spaziale più brutto che abbia mai visto, e lo dice uno che li ha visti tutti dai tempi del comodore 64.
2 euro buttati... mi spiace per chi lo ha preso a prezzo pieno.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978820749', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1475614429}
review:
I've been playing this game a few hours now and im finding it an oddly emotional experience.

The more you grind on through the identikit dog fights and larger scale Nazi "space zepplin" fights; the more you start thinking/questioning. 

"whats actualy going on here?, why are the zepplins towing huge asteroids toward earth?"

It starts to dawn on you that you are protecting earth from these asteroids. You and fighters from every nation (complete with halo esque accents).

The emotional part comes in with the strikingly beautiful and sad rendition of the American anthem that plays when you visit your home base. It can realy catch you off guard...leave you floating there just pondering the lyrics and what they are trying to acheive with this.

It realy never loses its initial impact and as more of the story unfolds it takes on more and more meaning. 

The FMV is intensionaly bad!! and funny, rather disarming considering whats actualy going on.
In the very limited premise of this game is something well worth a purchse if you can find it cheap. Cult classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974848672', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1632768388}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017880926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1421862643}
review:
Ce jeu est de la mer....de je m'explique de facon brut car il n'a pas besoin de plus d'explication pour un tel niveau.

En faite en regardant sur steam et sur internet je me suis dit a la limite il sera un jeu dans la moyenne avec aucun points fort, et bien c'est pire que cela.
Il n'a rien de bien, ni rien dans la moyenne de n'importe quelle space opéra depuis les années 90 à nos jours, même "xcom interceptor" sortie en 1995 ou 1997 (je ne sais plus) est nettement mieu en musique, stratégie, gestion, combat, dialogues, technologie, etc.... à la limite seul les graphismes ici sont mieu qu'un jeu sortie dans les années 90. sinon rien d'autre ne lui arrive à la cheville.
Je les acheter 3.5 euro addons comprise en promo, résultat 1h00 de jeu et sa me gonfle de continuer. Tout est plat dans ce jeu. Un conseil fuillez réellement ce jeu même à -80 à -90%.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984645663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1421754800}
review:
Oparta na filmie Iron Sky kosmiczna symulacja, zblizona pomysłem do X-Winga czy innego Freespace'a. Zabawna jak niemieckia wymowa "rhrr" i relaksujaca jak nazistowski marsz. Gra dla każdego kto szuka nieskomplikowanej rozrywki i relaksu w niszczeniu nazistowskiej inwazji z Księżyca.
Gra warta swojej promocyjnej ceny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982782989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1421725321}
review: I got this not expecting much but once I started playing I cound not put it down.  The combat was fast and fun and the cutscenes good and funny.   Reminds me of the old Command and Conquer videos.   I hope they make a sequel to this game.  Much better that Space Rogue that I tried did not like.   Im an old timer from Wing Commander, Free Lancer, and Tie Fighter days and had elements of them all.   It works great with the XBOX 360 controller too :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198029216361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1422284276}
review:
[b]Get a pad![/b]
I can't emphasize that enough. This game is pretty much unplayable without a controller. And even then the control scheme is bad. No, you can't reassign keys, so you're stuck with them. And no joystick support by the way, in this space sim.
But once you get over the bad controls, this is actually pretty fun little space shooter. Especially when considering that it is a licenced game and the movie it is based was a huge disappointment. I think it was James Rolfe who said something like: "A good movie makes a bad video game, and a bad movie makes a not so bad game." Luckily you can skip all those live-action cutscenes.
I especially like how the ships you get to fly look pretty realistic. Like that's how they would be when they start manufacturing spaceships in real life. And I think one of them is a rip-off of Normandy from Mass Effect -series.
Just wait for sales.

[b]Pelaa ohjaimella![/b]
Ylläolevaa ei voi painottaa liikaa. Tämä peli on pelikelvoton ilman ohjainta. Ja senkin jälkeen ohjaustoiminnot ovat huonoja. Ei ole mahdollista vaihtaa näppäimiä, vaan niihin on tyydyttävä. Eikä tässä avaruussimulaattorissa ole tukea edes joystickille.
Mutta kunhan huonojen ohjainten yli pääsee, on tässä ihan hauska pikku avaruusräiskintä. Varsinkin kun ottaa huomioon kyseessä olevan lisenssipeli ja pohjalla oleva elokuva oli valtaisa pettymys. Taisi olla James Rolfe, joka sanoi "Hyvästä elokuvasta saa huonon pelin, ja huonosta elokuvasta ei niin huonon pelin." Onneksi elokuvamaiset välivideot saa jätettyä välistä.
Alukset näyttävät myös oikeanlaisilta. Tarkoitan, että tältä ne näyttäisivät, jos avaruusalusten valmistaminen aloitettaisiin oikeasti. Joskin yksi oli selvästi kopio Mass Effect -sarjan Normandiasta.
Odota alennusta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071923499', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1440104121}
review:
On my previous review, i told You all that this game is really shit. I was wrong. Last week I completed it, and I have to say, it was really nice and different adventure!
Pros:
+ Nice, realistic cut-scenes
+ War with Nazis in space? Why not!
+ Soundtrack
+ Graphics aren't so bad

Cons:
- Controls, really, it's hard but with a bit of training You can play!
- It's short [4-6h]
- Some Side-quests are more stupid than others...

All I can say about this game, it's nice, different, climatic, but some part of You'll have problems with  controls. For me, game is actually 8/10. It's also nice trophy for Achievement Hunters. Achivs. in this game are pretty easy, on my 1st playthrough I did 27/30 but you can do all 30 in 1 run! 
Good Luck and killing Nazis in space!

review:
Con la verdad por delante, diré que no es un juego bueno. Se trata de eliminar naves nazis una y otra vez, parece casi sin fin. Pero, tiene su gracia. Los controles cuesta un poquitín hacerse a ellos, pero en cuando se les coge el truco tenemos un juego con una buena jugabilidad, unos videos que si también son divertidos, al final acabas adelantándote a lo que van a decir los personajes.
Diría que un 5/10 es la nota que merece este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015230847', 'num_games_owned': 1533, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1416571668}
review:
Iron Sky: Invasion, could be best summed up in the phrase 'wasted potential.' At it's core, it's an arcadey space shooter. You fly around in space while aimiing your cursor at painted targets. What stands out about the game is the  various, neat, little systems it incorporates. A large map covering the space between the Earth and Moon is filled with various space stations and allied ships. Enemeis are marked as well, travelling in groups. Quests dot the map and while some are critical path, others are completely optional. Ships travel in real time, meaning that while you're completing one mission, a seperate quest may have passed by, or a set of enemy ships may have made their way closer to Earth.

Reminiscent of X-Wing, shields, weapons and engines can draw off each other, giving combat a little depth. It's deepened as well by how you can individually target cannons or engines on ships, wearing them down in chunks instead of slowly draining them with imprecise fire. Heavier fighters have weak spots, and the game has no fixed plane, allowing you to flay around in any direction you want and line yourself up to take those weaker points.

What drags the game down is the repetitive nature of the game. Once you know how to approach a situation, combat becomes rote as you first target the light ships then start chipping at the bigger ones. I only ran into one or two scenarios where I was genuinely engaged in executing a strategy.

While it's novel that they used the actors from the movie for unique in-game FMVs, the acting is unbearable. It's dull and unfunny and the game's plot is lifeless as well. The mission videos are also badly timed, as it seems they were recorded at a different time than when the game's voice actor recorded his.

It's evident that someone at the development studio cared about this game, which makes it stand out a bit amongst terrible movie tie-in games. It's not enough to rescue it though. That said, I would be genuinely interested in seeing Reality Pump further develop the ideas laid down in this game; there's some genuinely talented designer(s) over there and they deserve the chance to make a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163367324', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1429880581}
review:
[h1]Поверил хорошим отзывам, "блджад".[/h1]
Сразу в игре замечена не хватка "скольжения" кораблем, т.е. [u]во круг своей оси он крутится, а в право-лево не скользит[/u]) Вроде 21 век, думал во всех играх такое ввели, а нет - нюанс, однако.

Первое время не хватало, как в сериях "X3", маркера цели, здесь самому приходится определять на какое упреждение стрелять, а если учесть люфт и инертность корабля к этому надо еще приноровиться

Через время отмечено - некая помощь в прицеливании со стороны интерфейса есть, но какая же это система...:
Квадрат-ромб выделяет именно корабль(!) противника при условии, что ты угадал упреждение и правильно навел прицелом перед кораблем (!!). В этом случае на мгновение (пока прицел в нужной точки) мигнет ромб во круг корабля (Например, в серии "х3" или "Strice Suit Zero"  указывают место куда целится на упреждение (перед кораблем) эта отметка передвигается быстро, порой неожиданно и резко меняет направление, в этом и появляется схожесть с шутером). В общем [u]все сводится к тому, чтобы водить прицелом перед кораблем врага, одним глазом смотреть куда целишься, а другим следить когда на долю секунды корабль врага подсветится ромбом.[/u]

Как следствие:
Меня не покидало ощущение ватности и тягучести. Это же игра-экшн, где динамика? Хорошо, корабли пока умирают быстро, [u]но этот укуреный прицел... настолько инертный, что прицелится реально тяжело (не смотря на то, что корабли противника не менее инертно меняют траекторию). [/u]

[u]Следствие 2[/u]: 
Так как дым курева повлиял и на противника, если на поле боя кроме тебя есть и союзники (как в начале при уничтожении материнского корабля), то [u]у пилота может сложился комплекс не хватки внимания.[/u] Ибо попадают не ахти, и это если вообще замечают! За бой меня задело пару раз и то, кажется, это случайно под очередь головного корабля попал. Куда стрелял он не знаю.

Суть игры:
Выделил цель, спокойно в медитации поводил указателем, немного полетал за врагом - появился квадратик - мгновенно, ежесекундно щелкай! или опять будешь в медитации угадывать нужное расстояние. И вот так кораблей 5, 10, 15..  общем сколько сколько решишь фармить) Чтобы из-за неспешных действий была проиграна миссия не наблюдал.

Черт побери, наскучивает. Не знаю, может это только начало такое?

Все это разабавляется роликами, напоминающими мне о Red Alert 2. Хотя у тетки в красном сиськи ниче вроде, но она в пиджаке, в общем ролики сливаю сразу.
[list]
 [*]Из + корабли можно улучшать и их несколько, по крайней мере практически в начале доступны  типа, характеристики разные.
 [*]Правда есть возможность фарма. Например, надо уничтожить материнский корабль - вы можете спокойно часа 10мин-10часов убивать ботов из его недр, а потом начать уничтожать цель.
[/list]

Не исключаю, может просто не просек фишку. Забил практически в начале.
В заключение добила не понятная система сохранений - вышел как полагается, меню все дела, и ничего не сохранилось)

Любителям медитативного экшена может и приглянется.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110129069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1407242868}
review: Aver... resulta complejo analizar juegos como este por el hecho de poder decir solo si y no. Iron sky es una risa si te gustan las peliculas cutres, viste la pelicula y te gustó. Esto suple las carencias de un juego que por lo general resulta mediocre y confuso. El sistema de redirección de energias aporta un elemento realista en la delirante historia así como las constantes caricaturas a las idiosincracias de los paises de la ONU. Pero en general no recomendaria gastar dinero en la compra de este juego

author: {'steamid': '76561198056928006', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1416879170}
review: I guess if you've never played a flight sim like colony wars, these controls would be "horrible" but if you know how to play one of these, they're actually pretty solid.  Nothing flashy, near futuristic ship models, nazi ufos, very intentional B movie scripting.  If you like to fly around and blow things up, this is pretty fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008001366', 'num_games_owned': 1018, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1405209144}
review:
short version: an average, semi open world, space shooter with repetitive gameplay but a nice cheesy story that should last you 5 to 7 hours. Recommended on sales
Longer version:
what I liked
- over the top,  almost nonsensical story
- cheesy live action cinematics. (beware lots of Satirical use of ethnic stereotypes)
- decent number of ships ( paying about 2 dollars I had very low expectations)
- different enemy ships have different week spots on their hauls adding a bit of variety to the fighting
- the overmap gives the game a bit of sandboxy field
- I liked the designs of the ships very much

What I did not like:
- enemy variety. I remember about 6 enemy types which is not too bad for a budget title but still repetitive for 7 hours
- lack of veriety in weapons
- upgrade system is linear and is mostly stat increase rather than adding new unique abilities
- game play is repetitive
- game does not explain itself well. For example , I don't remember the game mentioning the concept of week points
- some Setpiece are very buggy and clunky (specially the last mission)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997840319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1415756877}
review: I enjoy this game quite a bit. First I am a fan of the film so the fact they got several of the actors to come back and do their rolls again for the fmv portions just brigns back all the sillyness of the movie. Second the space combat feels very much like it was inspired by freespace...though very watered down. If anythign I have to say this game only has two real flaws 1. many of the side missions given will appear randomly and are timed with no way to re attempt them with out replaying hte chapter. and 2, this game is insanely easy. As long as you are in range and kinda sorta pointed in the right direction you will hit your target. Other then that, See the movie first, expect horible silly story, embrace its intentionaly awful nature. This game is just meant for silly fun and is a decent reminder of the space combat games of old. Seriously all the guts for a great Freespace style game are here, it just needs to be polished the right way. Oh, and pretty much just ignore the game bullet points on the store front, most of it is prettty much either wrong, misleading, or exageration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007357253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1521659115}
review:
Dieses Spiel scheint sehr gemischte Gefühle ausgelöst zu haben. Als jemand, der den Film ("Iron Sky", falls ihn jemand nicht kennt) gesehen hat, fand ich dieses Spiel einen Geniestreich, weil es perfekt dort weitermacht, wo der Film geendet hat.
Die Steuerung selbst ist nichts herausragendes, aber grundsolide; die Missionen nicht übermäßig variantenreich, aber spaßig. 
Warum also eine Kaufempfehlung für ein Spiel, dessen Mechaniken eher Mittelmaß sind?
Weil es absolut liebevoll gestaltet wurde und den Humor des Films enthält. Es gibt Videosequenzen mit den Schauspielern aus dem Film und sehr gute Ideen, so dass man auch immer mal wieder aus dem Schema F ausbrechen kann.  

Meiner Meinung nach ist es eine klare Kaufempfehlung für Leute, die den Film mochten und gerne eine einfache, aber sehr schön umgesetzte Weltraumsimulation spielen möchten. 
Wenn man es sich in einem Sale holt, wäre es das definitiv wert!
Ich kann nur vermuten, dass einige der vom Spiel enttäuschten Menschen den Film nicht kennen und somit den besten Aspekt dieses Spiels nicht zu schätzen wissen (können)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078447824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1411315774}
review:
Meiner Meinung nach ist Iron Sky: Invasion ein schlechtes Spiel. Die Story ist überhaupt nicht gelungen und die Steuerung ist sehr schwer, da man sein Raumschiff mit der Tastatur kaum beherrschen kann, empfehle ich das Spiel mit einem Kontroller zu spielen. Die Grafik ist akzeptabel und erfüllt ihren Zweck. Außerdem sind die Namen der Nazi-Gegner sehr lächerlich, sodass sie nicht mehr ernst genommen werden können.

Ich empfehle dieses Spiel auf keinen Fall !!
